item.title: Fantasy Life i: Every Purple Seal Location (& Rewards)
item.description:
Completing story quests in Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time gradually opens up more explorable worlds in the game, encouraging players to search every corner for valuable loot and rewards. However, not all the paths and rooms are unlocked earlier in the game; the developers have saved some spaces for the endgame exploration.

Upon roaming around the caves and dungeons in Fantasy Life i , you will come across rooms that are blocked by a purple seal. The game will not offer any useful hints regarding them, but lifting those seals is an ability that will only be available after beating the story campaign. Players will need to earn items known as Dark Fire - the spending of which lifts the seal and allows them to explore the rooms beyond. These rooms are full of lucrative loot, from simple chests to high-level monsters, and the amount of Dark Fire required is different from one seal to another.

Quetzal Nest Purple Seal Location & Loot in Fantasy Life i

Probably the first location that most players witness a purple seal in Fantasy Life i is either Quetzal Nest or Banaan Cave, both of which are located inside the Capital of Mysteria . Quetzal Nest is a small cave in the northwest of the region. It's primarily the home of Tunoco Quetzal, a boss bird resting on top of the cave's roof.

However, the entry to the cave does feature a branching path blocked by a purple seal. This seal will only cost 10 Dark Fires , and there is a single chest behind it that drops random loot based on the player's luck. So, it's not a big one, and you can delay it until you have unlocked all the other seals.

Banaan Cave Purple Seal Location & Loot in Fantasy Life i

Although Banaan Cave features the cheapest purple seal, it actually offers better rewards compared to Quetzal Nest. To get to Banaan Cave, head southwest of the Capital of Mysteria , and you will find the entrance to a cave near the beach. Inside the cave, you will find a boss fish as well as the sealed path.

Spending only 5 Dark Fires will lift the seal, and beyond it, there are four chests ready to be looted, two in the middle and two in the corner of the room. There are no minable rocks or trees inside the room, but that's still good value for 5 Dark Fires.

Warren Willow Hollow B1 Purple Seal Location & Loot in Fantasy Life i

The Capital of Mysteria alone hosts most of the purple seals. In the northwest of the region, you will find a cave surrounded by a circular garden. That's the entrance to Warren Willow Hollow, but to find the purple seal, you will need to head all the way to the end of the path and take the stairs down to reach level B1. Take the straight path ahead, and you will reach the purple seal.

This is the most expensive seal in the game, requiring 50 Dark Fires before it can be lifted. Beyond the seal, you will find a Level 55 Luminous Magic Ore Deposit as well as a Luminous Darkwood Tree of the same level. There is also a single chest offering a random drop. A few mushrooms and some destructible boxes are the least valuable loot inside the room.

It's worth noting that some Shadow Carroty enemies are also hidden in the room, killing which could return a few Dark Fires to your inventory if you are lucky enough.

The Depths B1 Purple Seal Location & Loot in Fantasy Life i

The Depths is located in the Present timeframe, and making some progress in the main campaign will eventually lead you there. However, before you find the purple seal, you will need to lift some other path blockers, like a big boulder. The purple seal blocks access to the room in the bottom-right corner of the map.

You will have to spend 30 Dark Fires to lift the seal, and beyond it, there is a boss monster waiting for you, along with a loot chest . The monster is a Level 70 Shadow Carrotella with a bunch of Shadow Carrots supporting it. The boss has a 5-minute cooldown after being defeated.

This room is only good for players who have made enough progress in one of the Mercenary lives.

Lulab Forest Purple Seal Location & Loot in Fantasy Life i

Located on Faraway Island , Lulab Forest is divided into two regions. You will first enter its eastern branch, but after exiting the forest, the wooden bridges will lead you to the western branch, which is where the purple seal is located, as well as the path to Spirit Road. You simply need to reach the room in the top-left corner of the map.

The seal can be lifted after spending 30 Dark Fires , and the rewards beyond it will make both fishing fans and woodcutters pretty happy. The room features two Cherry Trees , one Great Cherry Tree , and one Level 60 Luminous Darkwood Tree . Moreover, you will find a Level 25 Big Fish Shadow , which is not as impressive as trees but still serves as good loot. Lastly, there is a chest in the room.

Spirit Road Purple Seal Location & Loot in Fantasy Life i

The path to Spirit Road is through the Lulab Forest . If you manage to reach the room in the southeast corner of Lulab Forest's western branch, there is a well in there that leads to Spirit Road, but you need to interact with the well first.

Explore the Spirit Road carefully, and you will find the purple seal as marked on the map. This seal costs 30 Dark Fires to be lifted, and the loot beyond it will please farmers the most. There are two rooms beyond the seal. The first room hosts two Level 60 Amazing Blue Ore Deposits , as well as one instance of every Anthurium flower variant.

Moving to the second room, you will find three farming platforms, with a Level 60 Wicked Mandrake in the middle. This is amazing loot for farmers. On top of that, it respawns after 5 minutes. There is also a chest behind the Mandrake.

Yohoho Cavern Purple Seal Location & Loot in Fantasy Life i

For anyone who loves fishing, lifting the purple seal in Yohoho Cavern is a must. Starting with the seal's location, Yohoho Cavern is a cave in the southwest corner of the Tropical Isles . Once you enter the cave, follow the path to the room in the top-right corner of the map.

Lifting the seal costs 30 Dark Fires , but if you don't have a fishing license or any fishing buddies, don't lift the seal. Beyond the seal, there is nothing more than a Level 60 Rare Fish Shadow . It's a pretty amazing hunt for those who have made enough progress in fishing, but there is nothing else in the room, not even a single loot chest.

Cave Of Trials B1 Purple Seal Location & Loot in Fantasy Life i

Located on Swolean Island , the Cave of Trials is a big dungeon with multiple levels and multiple exit points. After entering the cave from its beach gate, head down to level B1, which is where the seal is located. It's blocking the path to the room in the bottom-left corner of the map.

You'd better have 30 Dark Fires in the inventory to lift the seal, and beyond it, you will find some decent rocks to mine. The room includes a few Gold Deposits and one Great Gold Deposit , along with a Level 60 Luminous Magic Ore Deposit . These are the biggest scores you will get from this room, along with a loot chest and a few mushrooms.

item.title: A Star Wars Battlefront 3 Has the Weight of a Galaxy on Its Shoulders
item.description:
Not long ago, Star Wars Battlefront seemed lost to a galaxy far, far away. There’s always been a dedicated corner of the Star Wars community that adores the Battlefront franchise, sure, but third installments have had bad omens associated with them. For instance, Free Radical’s nearly finished Star Wars Battlefront 3 was canceled and Pandemic’s attempt at a third installment buckled as it was only given a year of development time.

With seemingly no plans for a third Star Wars Battlefront following DICE and EA’s 2015 reboot and DICE, Criterion, Motive, and EA’s 2017 reboot sequel, a hypothetical third reboot entry has been struck with bittersweet optimism via Star Wars Battlefront 2 ’s highest ever concurrent player counts on Steam, which Star Wars Battlefront 2 ’s own Iden Versio, Janina Gavankar, shared in a social media post.

All stars seem to be aligning in terms of player and developer demand. But, if by some miracle there is a future where a Star Wars Battlefront 3 comes to fruition, it must consider including every shred of Star Wars iconography imaginable in order to ensure its longevity and franchise comprehensiveness.

Star Wars Battlefront 3 Has Been Given a New Hope

No matter how enticing and hopeful the idea of a possible Star Wars Battlefront 3 may be, especially with Star Wars Battlefront 2 developers having recently shared an interest in returning to the franchise, it’s important to recognize that it’s still facing terribly low odds. If a Star Wars Battlefront 3 wasn’t already in development, this might not be a pivotal enough display to make a difference. It’s undeniably neat, though, how many voices are speaking out to demonstrate a desire for the franchise to continue.

Plus, even if one was to enter development due to this abrupt surge in excitement and potential, it doesn’t necessarily mean that it wouldn’t meet the same fate as its predecessor, though at least studios should know what glaring cardinal sins to avoid by circumventing Star Wars Battlefront 2 ’s mistakes.

Against All Odds, a Star Wars Battlefront 3 Must Endure

Regardless, one way a Star Wars Battlefront 3 could hopefully sustain itself and not go extinct is by featuring all possible content in the Star Wars lore, whether it’s canonical, a part of Legends, or otherwise. Andor is one of Star Wars ’ most successful and popular projects in quite some time and is indeed what stirred a renewed interest and popularity in Star Wars Battlefront 2 , with Andor actor Muhannad Ben Amor chiming in on Star Wars Battlefront 3 discourse favorably.

Therefore, if only to commemorate the Disney+ show as a monumental piece of tinder in its catalytic spark, Andor content in Star Wars Battlefront 3 would be essential, whether that’s via playable characters like Cassian Andor, Bix Caleen, and Syril Karn, or maps like Ferrix, Narkina 5, and Ghorman. Spanning every Star Wars era and medium, a Battlefront 3 could sate nearly every die-hard fan while also having endless DLCs, expansions, and updates.

This could include expansions that players would be familiar with from previous games, such as Star Wars Battlefront ’s epic Rogue One: Scarif DLC with Jyn Erso and Orson Krennic, as well as expansions that feature characters and content that has yet to grace the series, such as a possible Star Wars: The Force Unleashed or Star Wars Zero Company update. It might not be what led to them ending development, but DICE’s Star Wars Battlefront games restricting themselves to the theatrical Skywalker Saga between episodes 1–9 always meant that they’d hit a ceiling they couldn’t shatter eventually.

It would be exhilarating seeing a new Battlefront game explore the modern sensibilities of the live-service multiplayer shooter genre and doing so with limitless content at its disposal throughout every nook and cranny of Star Wars could allow it to have a tremendous shelf life. A Star Wars Battlefront 3 would be a dream come true and, considering how low its chances are now, it’d have to pull no punches and truly take advantage of the opportunity it’d have because there might never be another like it.

item.title: Grow a Garden: How to Get a Snail (& What it Does)
item.description:
There are many different pets that players can have work on their garden in Roblox 's Grow a Garden thanks to the animal update. These pets not only help you grow your agricultural empire, but you can also spend time looking after them.

From pandas to pigs, there are all manner of different animals you can have working in your garden, but not all of them are as useful as others. One of the best pets to have in your garden is the humble snail, but it's one of the rarest in the game due to being of Mythical rarity. Here's how to get a snail in Grow a Garden and what makes it so valuable.

How to Get a Snail in Grow a Garden

The Snail has a 40% chance of hatching from a Bug Egg. All types of animal eggs can be purchased from the Pet Egg stand found at the opposite end of the island from the Seed and Sell Stuff stands. It's got a yellow and white roof, and three eggs can be seen on the left side of it.

While the chance of getting a Snail from a Bug Egg is the highest of all the possible animals that can hatch from it, the Bug Egg itself has an incredibly low 3% chance of appearing in the Egg Shop and also costs 50 million Sheckles , which is a huge amount. It can also be purchased for 199 Robux, should you be happy to spend some of your premium Roblox currency on it.

The Pet Egg stand refreshes its stock every 30 minutes, so be sure to check back regularly to maximize your chances of finding the Bug Egg for sale.

After buying the Bug Egg from the Pet Egg Shop, you'll need to place it in your garden and wait eight hours for it to hatch. Time counts down even when you're not playing the game, so feel free to exit and come back later if you've got other things to do.

What Does the Snail Do in Grow a Garden?

Once placed in your garden, the Snail gives you a 5% chance of getting a seed from any harvested plant. This means that, on average, one in every 20 plants that you harvest will get you a free seed. There's no guarantee that it will be exactly every 20 plants, and you can't tell when you're about to get a free seed.

It's also worth noting that the Snail grants a lower chance of getting a seed when harvesting rarer plants in Grow a Garden . However, if you have multiple snails, you can stack the trait to increase your chances of getting that extra seed.

You'll also need to feed your Snail to increase its age. You can feed any animal by using the fruits/crops you harvest from your garden. The Snail has a Hunger bar of 12,000, but the efficacy of its trait will improve as it ages.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Players Find Underwater Character Many Didn't Know Existed
item.description:
Summary

  • A leaker has claimed that Oblivion Remastered could be coming to Nintendo Switch 2 in the future.
  • A player recently discovered a character named Tooth-in-the-Sea lurking underwater in Niben Bay.
  • One person shared an experience they had that involved a Skingrad guard chasing them through an Oblivion Gate.

One person playing The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered recently came across a character named Tooth-in-the-Sea who was just lurking underwater in Niben Bay near Bravil. The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered was shadow-dropped on April 22 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.

It was recently leaked that another version of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered might be in development. According to the leaker Extas1s, Bethesda's popular RPG could be coming to Nintendo Switch 2 at some point in the future. While the rumor still hasn't been confirmed, many players are already excited about the possibility of getting their hands on a Nintendo Switch 2 version of the title. Such a port would allow people to take the massive RPG with them wherever they go, allowing some fans to sink even more time into the game.

In a recent post on Reddit, leadraine shared an image of a character named Tooth-in-the-Sea lurking underwater in Niben Bay near Bravil. Several players were quick to comment that, even though they'd been playing the game since its original release in 2006, they had never come across the mysterious Argonian before. Others pointed out that Tooth-in-the-Sea is actually a master trainer for the Alteration skill in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered . Master trainers play a crucial role within the world, as they help the player raise skills beyond level 70. However, these trainers require that a specific quest or condition be met before they will teach the player anything.

Oblivion Remastered Player Finds NPC Lurking Underwater

Since the game's release on April 22, many players have been busy sharing their unique experiences and discoveries with fellow gamers online. One person recently shared an unusual encounter they had in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered after passing through an Oblivion Gate. While attempting to close the Oblivion Gate, the player decided to sneak around, which can help one get the jump on enemies. However, the stealth indicator showed a fully opened eye, which meant someone or something could see them. After looking around, the player spotted a guard from Skingrad running up to them. As it turns out, the player had committed a crime in Skingrad and the dedicated guard followed them quite a long way and through an Oblivion Gate to make an arrest.

Another gamer recently shared that they made Abraham Lincoln in The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered . The player made impressive use of the title's customization options, as the character bears a striking resemblance to the historical figure. While Bethesda's popular RPG may be a single-player title, it seems as if many people have built a community around sharing their experiences with fellow fans.

item.title: June 17 is Going to Be a Super Busy Day for PlayStation Plus
item.description:
Summary

  • FBC: Firebreak is coming to PS Plus Extra on June 17, a day-one game from Remedy Entertainment.
  • June 17 will be busy as new Extra and Premium games are added, but other titles will be removed.
  • At least six games are leaving Extra and Premium on June 17 so far.

Tuesday, June 17 is set to be a big day for PlayStation Plus , especially those who are signed up for the Extra and Premium tiers. PlayStation Plus has had a rough go about it lately, with major games axed from the service and not enough new titles added to make up the difference. Time will tell how June 2025 shakes out, but things are already looking up.

The way PS Plus announcements work is Sony reveals the Essential free games on the Wednesday before the first Tuesday of the following month. This means that PS Plus subscribers will learn about the free games for June 2025 on Wednesday, May 28. As far as the Essential and Premium announcements go, the June 2025 new additions will likely be revealed on Wednesday, June 11, to be added on Tuesday, June 17.

A fresh batch of PS Plus Extra and Premium games is coming on June 17. We don't know the full extent of what the new game additions will entail, but we do know of at least one game that's coming to PlayStation Plus that day. It's been confirmed that FBC: Firebreak is a day one PS Plus Extra game, meaning Extra and Premium tier subscribers will get to play it in its entirety starting June 17. For the uninitiated, FBC: Firebreak is the next game from Remedy Entertainment. But while Remedy is primarily known for its cinematic single-player games, FBC: Firebreak is a co-op shooter set in the same universe as Control . In fact, it has players teaming up in the Oldest House, which is where Control was set.

FBC: Firebreak is Coming to PS Plus Extra on June 17

It's somewhat rare for PS Plus to get day one games. The last time this happened was when Blue Prince was added to PS Plus Extra, so FBC: Firebreak 's debut alone is enough to make Tuesday, June 17 a busy one for subscribers. However, that day will be busy for another, less exciting reason as well. Not only will new PS Plus Extra and Premium games be added on June 17, but some titles will be removed from the service that same day as well.

PS Plus Extra and Premium Games Leaving Soon

  • After Us
  • AVICII Invector
  • Inscryption
  • Kayak VR: Mirage
  • Monster Hunter Rise
  • Rogue Legacy 2

So far, we know of at least six games leaving PS Plus Extra and Premium on June 17. After Us , AVICII Invector , Inscryption , Kayak VR: Mirage , Monster Hunter Rise , and Rogue Legacy 2 are all on the chopping block. While there are fewer games than left in May, these are some of the highest-rated PS Plus games currently available. Here's hoping the new additions outweigh the departures, but regardless, PS Plus fans can expect June 17 to be a busy day.
